text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kishioku was born in Muroran on April 2, 1954. After graduating from Muroran Otani High School, he joined Japan Soccer League club Nippon Steel in 1973. He played 121 games and scored 1 goal in Japan Soccer League Division 1. On May 31, 1979, Kishioku debuted for the Japan national team against Indonesia. He played at 1980 Summer Olympics qualification. He played 10 games and scored 2 goals for Japan until 1980. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1979||5||0 |- |1980||5||2 |- !Total||10||2 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Hokkaid≈ç Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Nippon Steel Yawata SC players
title: Yuji Kishioku
